items.name: NSBOOTR_CUR
items.description: FLASH non-secure unique boot entry register

items.name: NSBOOTR_PRG
items.description: FLASH non-secure unique boot entry address

items.name: WRPSGN1R_CUR
items.description: FLASH write sector protection for Bank1

items.name: WRPSGN1R_PRG
items.description: FLASH write sector protection for Bank1

items.name: WRPSGN2R_CUR
items.description: FLASH write sector protection for Bank2

items.name: WRPSGN2R_PRG
items.description: FLASH write sector protection for Bank2

fields.name: LATENCY
fields.description: Read latency These bits are used to control the number of wait states used during read operations on both non-volatile memory banks. The application software has to program them to the correct value depending on the embedded Flash memory interface frequency and voltage conditions. ... Note: No check is performed by hardware to verify that the configuration is correct.

fields.name: WRHIGHFREQ
fields.description: Flash signal delay These bits are used to control the delay between non-volatile memory signals during programming operations. Application software has to program them to the correct value depending on the embedded Flash memory interface frequency. Please refer to for details. Note: No check is performed to verify that the configuration is correct. Two WRHIGHFREQ values can be selected for some frequencies.

fields.name: PRFTEN
fields.description: Prefetch enable. When bit value is modified, user must read back ACR register to be sure PRFTEN has been taken into account. Bits used to control the prefetch.

fields.name: S_PRFTEN
fields.description: Smart prefetch enable. When bit value is modified, user must read back ACR register to be sure S_PRFTEN has been taken into account. Bits used to control the prefetch functionality.

fields.name: ADDR_ECC
fields.description: ECC error address When an ECC error occurs (for single correction) during a read operation, the ADDR_ECC contains the address that generated the error. ADDR_ECC is reset when the flag error is reset. The embedded Flash memory programs the address in this register only when no ECC error flags are set. This means that only the first address that generated an ECC error is saved. The address in ADDR_ECC is relative to the Flash memory area where the error occurred (user Flash memory, system Flash memory, data area, read-only/OTP area).

fields.name: BK_ECC
fields.description: ECC bank flag for corrected ECC error It indicates which bank is concerned by ECC error

fields.name: SYSF_ECC
fields.description: ECC flag for corrected ECC error in system FLASH It indicates if system Flash memory is concerned by ECC error.

fields.name: OTP_ECC
fields.description: OTP ECC error bit This bit is set to 1 when one single ECC correction occurred during the last successful read operation from the read-only/ OTP area. The address of the ECC error is available in ADDR_ECC bitfield.

fields.name: ECCCIE
fields.description: ECC single correction error interrupt enable bit When ECCCIE bit is set to 1, an interrupt is generated when an ECC single correction error occurs during a read operation.

fields.name: ECCC
fields.description: ECC correction set by hardware when single ECC error has been detected and corrected. Cleared by writing 1.

fields.name: ADDR_ECC
fields.description: ECC error address When an ECC error occurs (double detection) during a read operation, the ADDR_ECC contains the address that generated the error. ADDR_ECC is reset when the flag error is reset. The embedded Flash memory programs the address in this register only when no ECC error flags are set. This means that only the first address that generated an double ECC error is saved. The address in ADDR_ECC is relative to the Flash memory area where the error occurred (user Flash memory, system Flash memory, data area, read-only/OTP area).

fields.name: BK_ECC
fields.description: ECC fail bank for double ECC Error It indicates which bank is concerned by ECC error

fields.name: SYSF_ECC
fields.description: ECC fail for double ECC error in system Flash memory It indicates if system Flash memory is concerned by ECC error.

fields.name: OTP_ECC
fields.description: OTP ECC error bit This bit is set to 1 when double ECC detection occurred during the last read operation from the read-only/ OTP area. The address of the ECC error is available in ADDR_ECC bit field.

fields.name: ECCD
fields.description: ECC detection set by hardware when two ECC error has been detected. When this bit is set, a NMI is generated. Cleared by writing 1. Needs to be cleared in order to detect subsequent double ECC errors.

fields.name: DATA_ECC
fields.description: ECC error data When an double detection ECC error occurs on special areas with 6-bit ECC on 16-bit of data (data area, read-only/OTP area), the failing data is read to this register. By checking if it is possible to determine whether the failure was on a real data, or due to access to uninitialized memory.

fields.name: HDP1_STRT
fields.description: HDPL barrier start set in number of 8 Kbytes sectors

fields.name: HDP1_END
fields.description: HDPL barrier end set in number of 8 Kbytes sectors

fields.name: HDP2_STRT
fields.description: Bank 2 HDPL barrier start set in number of 8 Kbytes sectors

fields.name: HDP2_END
fields.description: Bank 2 HDPL barrier end set in number of 8 Kbytes sectors

fields.name: HDP1_EXT
fields.description: HDP area extension in 8 Kbytes sectors in Bank1. Extension is added after the HDP1_END sector.

fields.name: HDP2_EXT
fields.description: HDP area extension in 8 Kbytes sectors in Bank2. Extension is added after the HDP2_END sector.

fieldset/NSBOOTR.description: FLASH non-secure unique boot entry register

fields.name: NSBOOT_LOCK
fields.description: A field locking the values of SWAP_BANK, and NSBOOTADD settings.

fields.name: NSBOOTADD
fields.description: unique boot entry address These bits reflect the UBE address

fields.name: CLR_EOP
fields.description: EOP flag clear bit Setting this bit to 1 resets to 0 EOP flag in FLASH_NSSR register.

fields.name: CLR_WRPERR
fields.description: WRPERR flag clear bit Setting this bit to 1 resets to 0 WRPERR flag in FLASH_NSSR register.

fields.name: CLR_PGSERR
fields.description: PGSERR flag clear bit Setting this bit to 1 resets to 0 PGSERR flag in FLASH_NSSR register.

fields.name: CLR_STRBERR
fields.description: STRBERR flag clear bit Setting this bit to 1 resets to 0 STRBERR flag in FLASH_NSSR register.

fields.name: CLR_INCERR
fields.description: INCERR flag clear bit Setting this bit to 1 resets to 0 INCERR flag in FLASH_NSSR register.

fields.name: CLR_OPTCHANGEERR
fields.description: Clear the flag corresponding flag in FLASH_NSSR by writing this bit.

fields.name: LOCK
fields.description: configuration lock bit This bit locks the FLASH_NSCR register. The correct write sequence to FLASH_NSKEYR register unlocks this bit. If a wrong sequence is executed, or if the unlock sequence to FLASH_NSKEYR is performed twice, this bit remains locked until the next system reset. LOCK can be set by programming it to 1. When set to 1, a new unlock sequence is mandatory to unlock it. When LOCK changes from 0 to 1, the other bits of FLASH_NSCR register do not change.

fields.name: PG
fields.description: programming control bit PG can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. PG allows programming in Bank1 and Bank2.

fields.name: SER
fields.description: sector erase request Setting SER bit to 1 requests a sector erase. SER can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. If MER and SER are also set, a PGSERR is raised.

fields.name: BER
fields.description: erase request Setting BER bit to 1 requests a bank erase operation (user Flash memory only). BER can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. If MER and SER are also set, a PGSERR is raised. Note: Write protection error is triggered when a bank erase is required and some sectors are protected.

fields.name: FW
fields.description: write forcing control bit FW forces a write operation even if the write buffer is not full. In this case all bits not written are set to 1 by hardware. FW can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. The embedded Flash memory resets FW when the corresponding operation has been acknowledged. Note: Using a force-write operation prevents the application from updating later the missing bits with something else than 1, because it is likely that it leads to permanent ECC error. Write forcing is effective only if the write buffer is not empty (in particular, FW does not start several write operations when the force-write operations are performed consecutively). Since there is just one write buffer, FW can force a write in bank1 or bank2.

fields.name: STRT
fields.description: erase start control bit STRT bit is used to start a sector erase or a bank erase operation. STRT can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. STRT is reset at the end of the operation or when an error occurs. It cannot be reseted by software.

fields.name: SNB
fields.description: sector erase selection number These bits are used to select the target sector for an erase operation (they are unused otherwise). SNB can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. ...

fields.name: MER
fields.description: Mass erase request Setting MER bit to 1 requests a mass erase operation (user Flash memory only). MER can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0. If BER or SER are both set, a PGSERR is raised. Error is triggered when a mass erase is required and some sectors are protected.

fields.name: EOPIE
fields.description: end of operation interrupt control bit Setting EOPIE bit to 1 enables the generation of an interrupt at the end of a program or erase operation. EOPIE can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0.

fields.name: WRPERRIE
fields.description: write protection error interrupt enable bit When WRPERRIE bit is set to 1, an interrupt is generated when a protection error occurs during a program operation. WRPERRIE can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0.

fields.name: PGSERRIE
fields.description: programming sequence error interrupt enable bit When PGSERRIE bit is set to 1, an interrupt is generated when a sequence error occurs during a program operation. PGSERRIE can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0.

fields.name: STRBERRIE
fields.description: strobe error interrupt enable bit When STRBERRIE bit is set to 1, an interrupt is generated when a strobe error occurs (the master programs several times the same byte in the write buffer) during a write operation. STRBERRIE can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0.

fields.name: INCERRIE
fields.description: inconsistency error interrupt enable bit When INCERRIE bit is set to 1, an interrupt is generated when an inconsistency error occurs during a write operation. INCERRIE can be programmed only when LOCK is cleared to 0.

fields.name: OPTCHANGEERRIE
fields.description: Option byte change error interrupt enable bit OPTCHANGEERRIE bit controls if an interrupt has to be generated when an error occurs during an option byte change. This bit can be programmed only when LOCK bit is cleared to 0.

fields.name: BKSEL
fields.description: Bank selector bit BKSEL can only be programmed when LOCK is cleared to 0. The bit selects physical bank, SWAP_BANK setting is ignored.

fields.name: BSY
fields.description: busy flag BSY flag indicates that a Flash memory is busy by an operation (write, erase, option byte change). It is set at the beginning of a Flash memory operation and cleared when the operation finishes or an error occurs.

fields.name: WBNE
fields.description: write buffer not empty flag WBNE flag is set when the embedded Flash memory is waiting for new data to complete the write buffer. In this state, the write buffer is not empty. WBNE is reset by hardware each time the write buffer is complete or the write buffer is emptied following one of the event below: the application software forces the write operation using FW bit in FLASH_NSCR the embedded Flash memory detects an error that involves data loss This bit cannot be reset by software writing 0 directly. To reset it, clear the write buffer by performing any of the above listed actions, or send the missing data.

fields.name: DBNE
fields.description: data buffer not empty flag DBNE flag is set when the embedded Flash memory interface is processing 6-bits ECC data in dedicated buffer. This bit cannot be set to 0 by software. The hardware resets it once the buffer is free.

fields.name: EOP
fields.description: end of operation flag EOP flag is set when a operation (program/erase) completes. An interrupt is generated if the EOPIE is set to 1. It is not necessary to reset EOP before starting a new operation. EOP bit is cleared by writing 1 to CLR_EOP bit in FLASH_NSCCR register.

fields.name: WRPERR
fields.description: write protection error flag WRPERR flag is raised when a protection error occurs during a program operation. An interrupt is also generated if the WRPERRIE is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_WRPERR bit in FLASH_NSCCR register clears WRPERR.

fields.name: PGSERR
fields.description: programming sequence error flag PGSERR flag is raised when a sequence error occurs. An interrupt is generated if the PGSERRIE bit is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_PGSERR bit in FLASH_NSCCR register clears PGSERR.

fields.name: STRBERR
fields.description: strobe error flag STRBERR flag is raised when a strobe error occurs (when the master attempts to write several times the same byte in the write buffer). An interrupt is generated if the STRBERRIE bit is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_STRBERR bit in FLASH_NSCCR register clears STRBERR.

fields.name: INCERR
fields.description: inconsistency error flag INCERR flag is raised when a inconsistency error occurs. An interrupt is generated if INCERRIE is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_INCERR bit in the FLASH_NSCCR register clears INCERR.

fields.name: OPTCHANGEERR
fields.description: Option byte change error flag OPTCHANGEERR flag indicates that an error occurred during an option byte change operation. When OPTCHANGEERR is set to 1, the option byte change operation did not successfully complete. An interrupt is generated when this flag is raised if the OPTCHANGEERRIE bit of FLASH_NSCR register is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_OPTCHANGEERR of register FLASH_CCR clears OPTCHANGEERR. Note: The OPTSTRT bit in FLASH_OPTCR cannot be set while OPTCHANGEERR is set.

fields.name: ADDR_OP
fields.description: Interrupted operation address.

fields.name: BK_OP
fields.description: Interrupted operation bank It indicates which bank was concerned by operation.

fields.name: SYSF_OP
fields.description: Operation in system Flash memory interrupted Indicates that reset interrupted an ongoing operation in System Flash.

fields.name: OTP_OP
fields.description: OTP operation interrupted Indicates that reset interrupted an ongoing operation in OTP area.

fields.name: CODE_OP
fields.description: Flash memory operation code

fields.name: OPTLOCK
fields.description: FLASH_OPTCR lock option configuration bit The OPTLOCK bit locks the FLASH_OPTCR register as well as all _PRG registers. The correct write sequence to FLASH_OPTKEYR register unlocks this bit. If a wrong sequence is executed, or the unlock sequence to FLASH_OPTKEYR is performed twice, this bit remains locked until next system reset. It is possible to set OPTLOCK by programming it to 1. When set to 1, a new unlock sequence is mandatory to unlock it. When OPTLOCK changes from 0 to 1, the others bits of FLASH_OPTCR register do not change.

fields.name: OPTSTRT
fields.description: Option byte start change option configuration bit OPTSTRT triggers an option byte change operation. The user can set OPTSTRT only when the OPTLOCK bit is cleared to 0. It’s set only by Software and cleared when the option byte change is completed or an error occurs (PGSERR or OPTCHANGEERR). It’s reseted at the same time as BSY bit. The user application cannot modify any FLASH_XXX_PRG embedded Flash memory register until the option change operation has been completed. Before setting this bit, the user has to write the required values in the FLASH_XXX_PRG registers. The FLASH_XXX_PRG registers are locked until the option byte change operation has been executed in non-volatile memory.

fields.name: SWAP_BANK
fields.description: Bank swapping option configuration bit SWAP_BANK controls whether Bank1 and Bank2 are swapped or not. This bit is loaded with the SWAP_BANK bit of FLASH_OPTSR_CUR register only after reset or POR.

fields.name: BOR_LEV
fields.description: Brownout level option status bit These bits reflects the power level that generates a system reset.

fields.name: BORH_EN
fields.description: Brownout high enable status bit

fields.name: IWDG_SW
fields.description: IWDG control mode option status bit

fields.name: WWDG_SW
fields.description: WWDG control mode option status bit

fields.name: NRST_SHDW
fields.description: Core domain Shutdown entry reset option status bit

fields.name: NRST_STOP
fields.description: Core domain Stop entry reset option status bit

fields.name: NRST_STDBY
fields.description: Core domain Standby entry reset option status bit

fields.name: PRODUCT_STATE
fields.description: Life state code (based on Hamming 8,4).

fields.name: IO_VDD_HSLV
fields.description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage status bit. This bit can be set only with VDD below 2.5 V.

fields.name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
fields.description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage status bit. This bit can be set only with VDDIO2 below 2.5 V.

fields.name: IWDG_STOP
fields.description: IWDG Stop mode freeze option status bit When set the independent watchdog IWDG is in system Stop mode.

fields.name: IWDG_STDBY
fields.description: IWDG Standby mode freeze option status bit When set the independent watchdog IWDG is frozen in system Standby mode.

fields.name: SWAP_BANK
fields.description: Bank swapping option status bit SWAP_BANK reflects whether Bank1 and Bank2 are swapped or not. SWAP_BANK is loaded to SWAP_BANK of FLASH_OPTCR after a reset.

fields.name: SRAM2_RST
fields.description: SRAM2 erase when system reset

fields.name: BKPRAM_ECC
fields.description: Backup RAM ECC detection and correction disable

fields.name: SRAM2_ECC
fields.description: SRAM2 ECC detection and correction disable

fields.name: SRAM1_RST
fields.description: SRAM1 erase upon system reset

fields.name: SRAM1_ECC
fields.description: SRAM1 ECC detection and correction disable

fields.name: LOCKBL
fields.description: OTP block lock Block n corresponds to OTP 16-bit word 32 x n to 32 x n + 31. LOCKBL[n] = 1 indicates that all OTP 16-bit words in OTP Block n are locked and attempt to program them results in WRPERR. LOCKBL[n] = 0 indicates that all OTP 16-bit words in OTP Block n are not locked. When one block is locked, it is not possible to remove the write protection. LOCKBL bits can be set if the corresponding bit in FLASH_OTPBLR_CUR is cleared.

fields.name: PRIVBB
fields.description: Privileged / unprivileged 8 Kbytes Flash Bank1 sector attribute (y = 0 to 7)

fields.name: NSPRIV
fields.description: privilege attribute for non secure registers

fields.name: SECBSY
fields.description: busy flag BSY flag indicates that a FLASH memory is busy by an operation (write, erase, option byte change, OBK operations, PUF operation). It is set at the beginning of a Flash memory operation and cleared when the operation finishes or an error occurs.

fields.name: SECWBNE
fields.description: write buffer not empty flag WBNE flag is set when the embedded Flash memory is waiting for new data to complete the write buffer. In this state, the write buffer is not empty. WBNE is reset by hardware each time the write buffer is complete or the write buffer is emptied following one of the event below: the application software forces the write operation using FW bit in FLASH_SECCR the embedded Flash memory detects an error that involves data loss This bit cannot be reset by writing 0 directly by software. To reset it, clear the write buffer by performing any of the above listed actions, or send the missing data.

fields.name: SECDBNE
fields.description: data buffer not empty flag DBNE flag is set when the embedded Flash memory interface is processing 6-bits ECC data in dedicated buffer. This bit cannot be set to 0 by software. The hardware resets it once the buffer is free.

fields.name: SECEOP
fields.description: end of operation flag EOP flag is set when a operation (program/erase) completes. An interrupt is generated if the EOPIE is set to. It is not necessary to reset EOP before starting a new operation. EOP bit is cleared by writing 1 to CLR_EOP bit in FLASH_SECCCR register.

fields.name: SECWRPERR
fields.description: write protection error flag WRPERR flag is raised when a protection error occurs during a program operation. An interrupt is also generated if the WRPERRIE is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_WRPERR bit in FLASH_SECCCR register clears WRPERR.

fields.name: SECPGSERR
fields.description: programming sequence error flag PGSERR flag is raised when a sequence error occurs. An interrupt is generated if the PGSERRIE bit is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_PGSERR bit in FLASH_SECCCR register clears PGSERR.

fields.name: SECSTRBERR
fields.description: strobe error flag STRBERR flag is raised when a strobe error occurs (when the master attempts to write several times the same byte in the write buffer). An interrupt is generated if the STRBERRIE bit is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_STRBERR bit in FLASH_SECCCR register clears STRBERR.

fields.name: SECINCERR
fields.description: inconsistency error flag INCERR flag is raised when a inconsistency error occurs. An interrupt is generated if INCERRIE is set to 1. Writing 1 to CLR_INCERR bit in the FLASH_SECCCR register clears INCERR.

fieldset/WRP.description: FLASH write sector protection for Bank2

fields.name: WRPSG
fields.description: Bank2 sector protection option status byte Setting WRPSG2 bits to 0 write protects the corresponding sectors in bank 2 (0: write protected; 1: not write protected)

variants.name: BANK1
variants.description: Bank1 is selected for Bank erase / sector erase / interrupt enable

variants.name: BANK2
variants.description: Bank1 is selected for Bank erase / sector erase / interrupt enable

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: No Flash operation on going during previous reset

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Single write operation interrupted

variants.name: B_0x3
variants.description: Sector erase operation interrupted

variants.name: B_0x4
variants.description: Bank erase operation interrupted

variants.name: B_0x5
variants.description: Mass erase operation interrupted

variants.name: B_0x6
variants.description: Option change operation interrupted

variants.name: B_0xB4
variants.description: The NSBOOTADD and SWAP_BANK are frozen.

variants.name: B_0xC3
variants.description: The SWAP_BANK and NSBOOTADD can still be modified following their individual rules.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: access to non secure registers is always granted

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: access to non secure registers is denied in case of non privileged access.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: BKPRAM ECC check enabled

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: BKPRAM ECC check disabled

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: BOR OFF, POR/PDR reset threshold level is applied

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: BOR Level 1, the threshold level is low (around 2.1 V)

variants.name: B_0x2
variants.description: BOR Level 2, the threshold level is medium (around 2.4 V)

variants.name: B_0x3
variants.description: BOR Level 3, the threshold level is high (around 2.7 V)

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature disabled (VDDIO2 can exceed 2.5 V)

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage feature enabled (VDDIO2 remains below 2.5 V)

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature disabled (VDD can exceed 2.5 V)

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage feature enabled (VDD remains below 2.5 V)

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Independent watchdog frozen in Standby mode

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Independent watchdog keep running in Standby mode.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Independent watchdog frozen in system Stop mode

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Independent watchdog keep running in system Stop mode.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: IWDG watchdog is controlled by hardware

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: IWDG watchdog is controlled by software

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: a reset is generated when entering Shutdown mode on core domain

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: no reset generated when entering Shutdown mode on core domain.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: a reset is generated when entering Standby mode on core domain

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: no reset generated when entering Standby mode on core domain.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: a reset is generated when entering Stop mode on core domain

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: no reset generated when entering Stop mode on core domain.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: SRAM2 ECC check enabled

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: SRAM2 ECC check disabled

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: WWDG watchdog is controlled by hardware

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: WWDG watchdog is controlled by software

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: sectors y in bank 1 is non privileged

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: sector y in bank 1 is privileged

variants.name: PROVISIONING
variants.description: Provisioning

variants.name: IROT_PROVISIONED
variants.description: iROT-Provisioned

variants.name: LOCKED
variants.description: Locked

variants.name: CLOSED
variants.description: Closed

variants.name: REGRESSION
variants.description: Regression

variants.name: OPEN
variants.description: Open
